author: Samy Adghirni, Ania Nussbaum
description: French president Emmanuel Macron said he doesn’t rule out the possibility of again dissolving the National Assembly and calling snap elections.
title: France’s Macron Doesn’t Rule Out Calling Snap Elections Again

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune has teed up a critical procedural vote Wednesday on stablecoin legislation supported by the crypto industry and President Donald Trump.
title: Crucial Stablecoin Bill Vote Teed Up in the Senate for This Week

author: Anthony Lin
description: A federal appeals court is closer to ruling on whether to keep most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs in place longer while the legal battle over them continues.
title: US Asks Appeals Court to Let Trump Tariffs Remain for Longer

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Laura Curtis
description: California labor leader David Huerta has been charged with a federal felony, accused of interfering with law enforcement after joining a protest against immigration arrest operations in Los Angeles that set off days of unrest.
title: California Labor Leader Charged With Felony After ICE Protest

author: Simone Iglesias, Martha Viotti Beck
description: La elevada inflación y el descontento económico impactan la popularidad de Lula. Sus aliados afirman que el verdadero problema es que el presidente de 79 años sigue anclado en el pasado.
title: Lula pasa de ser el “líder más popular del mundo”, a perder apoyo en Brasil

author: Simone Iglesias, Martha Viotti Beck
description: High inflation and economic discontent are hammering Lula’s approval. Allies say the real problem is a 79-year-old president who’s stuck in the past.
title: Once the World’s ‘Most Popular Politician,’ Lula Is Losing His Way in Brazil

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson said he’s pressuring Senate Republicans to refrain from changing a deal to increase the state and local tax deduction cap to $40,000, pushing back on President Donald Trump’s willingness to scale back the write-off.
title: Johnson Urges Senate to Minimize Changes to $40,000 SALT Deal

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: What to Watch for ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ in the Senate This Week

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Trump administration is sending about 700 active duty Marines to reinforce the National Guard in response to protests in Los Angeles, a person familiar with the matter said, continuing an escalation that California officials have called unwarranted.
title: Pentagon Sending 700 Marines to Counter Los Angeles Protests

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Tyler Kendall
description: President Donald Trump reiterated his desire to end his public spat with Elon Musk, telling reporters he would retain Starlink internet service at the White House and that he wished his billionaire backer “very well.”
title: Trump to Keep White House Starlink as Musk Feud Dissipates

author: Ken Parks
description: Paraguayan President Santiago Peña deleted a post on his X account after a likely hack by crypto scammers who claimed the South American nation had approved Bitcoin as legal tender.
title: Paraguay’s President Deletes Bitcoin Post in Likely Crypto Scam

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: The US government could run out of enough funds to meet its financial obligations in a timely manner between mid-August and the end of September, the Congressional Budget Office said Monday.
title: US May Exhaust Debt-Ceiling Measures in Mid-August, CBO Says

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said Iran was pressing to be allowed to enrich uranium in a potential nuclear deal with the US, expressing worry that Tehran was seeking too much.
title: Trump Says Iran Pushing to Enrich Uranium in ‘Tough’ Talks

author: Josh Saul
description: The developer of a New Jersey offshore wind farm designed to power more than 700,000 homes has pulled the plug on the project, the latest setback for a sector whose prospects have worsened under the Trump administration.
title: NJ Wind Project That Trump Dubbed a Disaster Is Canceled

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US is only sending observers to a UN conference on protecting the oceans that began Monday in France, part of the Trump administration’s broader retreat from multilateral institutions and the fight against climate change.
title: US Skips UN Ocean Conference After Rejecting Development Goals

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Trade talks between the US and China will continue into a second day, according to a US official, as the two sides look to ease tensions over shipments of technology and rare earth elements.
title: US, China Trade Talks to Continue Tuesday After Day One Wraps

author: Charlie Duxbury
description: Sweden’s rapid increase to its defense spending will be financed with debt in the coming years, the fiscally conservative Nordic state’s finance minister said.
title: Sweden Ready to Borrow to Fund Military Expansion, Minister Says

author: Bob Van Voris, Malathi Nayak
description: California is suing the Trump administration for deploying the state’s National Guard in Los Angeles to quell unrest over the president’s immigration raids.
title: California Suing US for Trump Use of National Guard in LA Unrest

author: Allyson Versprille
description: A bipartisan group of senators called on government watchdogs to examine the midair collision near DC in January, in part to determine whether shortfalls in managing the congested airspace contributed to the deadly accident.
title: Senators Call for Watchdog Probes of Midair Plane Collision Near DC

author: Alex Vasquez
description: The US Treasury on Monday sanctioned “Los Chapitos,” the faction of the Mexican Sinaloa Cartel controlled by the sons of jailed cartel leader Joaquín “El Chapo” Guzman that Washington says facilitates illicit fentanyl production and trafficking into the country.
title: US Sanctions Sons of ‘El Chapo’ Over Fentanyl Trafficking

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Tyler Kendall
description: President Donald Trump suggested California Governor Gavin Newsom should be arrested over his handling of unrest in Los Angeles, escalating his attacks on the state’s leaders.
title: Trump Says He ‘Would’ Arrest Newsom, Heightening Tensions

author: Gregory Korte
description: Federal employees ordered back to their offices under Donald Trump are now temporarily welcome to work from home to make way for parade preparations as the US Army marks its 250th birthday in Washington on Saturday.
title: Federal Employees Can Work From Home as DC Preps for Trump Parade

author: Alicia Clanton
description: The Los Angeles suburb of Glendale, California, canceled a longstanding contract to house federal immigration detainees at a local police department facility, citing rising public controversy over the arrangement.
title: LA Suburb Scraps Contract to House Immigration Detainees for ICE

author: Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum condemned what she described as human rights violations during the detention of Mexican migrants in anti-deportation protests in Los Angeles, adding that her government has activated all available consular mechanisms to help protect them.
title: Sheinbaum Vows to Protect Rights of Mexicans Detained in LA

author: Josh Wingrove, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump plans to gather corporate leaders at the White House Monday to highlight a provision in his tax bill that would deposit $1,000 into an investment account for babies born in the next few years, officials said Monday.
title: CEOs, Trump to Tout Child Investment Accounts in GOP Tax Bill

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, John Gittelsohn
description: Los Angeles is heading into a fourth day of unrest with California Governor Gavin Newsom vowing to sue to block the Trump administration’s deployment of National Guard troops in the city, escalating a standoff over immigration raids that sparked protests over the weekend.
title: LA Set for Fourth Day of Unrest as Newsom Resists National Guard

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Referendums to liberalize Italy’s naturalization rules and bolster workers’ rights failed to garner enough turnout, dashing opposition hopes that a strong showing could weaken the position of right-wing Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni.
title: Italian Vote on Citizenship, Labor Law Fails in Boost For Meloni

author: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan
description: Andrew Cuomo, the front-runner in New York’s Democratic mayoral primary, said raising taxes on the city’s wealthiest residents would cause an exodus to states like Florida and Texas.
title: Cuomo Says ‘Socialist’ Tax Hike Will Cause NYC Wealth Exodus

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: The United Nations nuclear watchdog said Iran’s rapidly increasing stockpile of uranium enriched to just below weapons grade cannot be allowed to continue without a firm international response.
title: UN Atomic Watchdog Says Iran Uranium Buildup Can’t Be Tolerated

author: Daniel Flatley, Catherine Lucey
description: Talks between the US and China kicked off in London, with the US signaling a willingness to remove restrictions on exports in exchange for assurances that China is easing limits on rare earth shipments.
title: US-China Trade Talks Start in London Aiming to Ease Export Curbs

author: Henry Meyer
description: Russia and Ukraine started a major prisoner exchange on Monday after days of wrangling cast doubt over the only concrete result of peace talks last week in Turkey.
title: Russia, Ukraine Start Delayed Prisoner Swap After Recriminations

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: London is set to miss out on extra funding for new infrastructure projects in Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ spending review on Wednesday, provoking an eleventh-hour row between the Treasury and the capital’s mayor, Sadiq Khan.
title: London Infrastructure Set to Miss Out in Reeves Spending Plans

author: Louise Moon
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to announce a large increase in defense spending which would allow Canada to meet NATO’s target this fiscal year, according to The Globe and Mail.
title: Canada Plans to Hike Defense Spending to Hit NATO Target, Globe Says

author: Shawn Donnan
description: One argument made for President Donald Trump’s tariffs is that they give him leverage over other countries. But what happens when signs emerge that his leverage is a diminishing asset?
title: Trump’s Leverage Wobbles as China Trade Talks Get Started

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Chile’s presidential hopefuls all seem to agree on one thing; the need to tackle what by global standards is a very moderate fiscal deficit. That marks a contrast with the US, and it’s showing up in bond spreads.
title: Chile-US Budget Contrast Pushes 30-Year Spread to Pre-Covid Lows

author: Alex Wickham
description: Keir Starmer’s government said more than three-quarters of pensioners in England and Wales will receive cold weather fuel payments this winter, reversing the bulk of a cut to the benefit that many of his lawmakers blamed for the ruling Labour Party’s waning popularity.
title: Starmer Reverses Cut to UK Winter Fuel Subsidy That Hurt Labour

author: Brad Stone
description: Trump is declaring an end to a postwar precedent.
title: America Cast Itself as the World’s Moral Leader. Not Anymore

author: Mark Niquette, Miranda Davis, Brooke Sutherland
description: President Donald Trump’s signature trade policy is threatening to backfire by upending other top priorities: the revival of US manufacturing and the American Rust Belt.
title: Trump’s Tariff Chaos Threatens His Push for Rust Belt Revival

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Everyone Is Buying Time in an Unstable World

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukraine said its drones hit a Russian research and production facility that supplies components for missiles, as Russia unleashed a fresh barrage of air attacks overnight.
title: Ukrainian Drones Hit Russian Plant Involved in Missile Output

author: Erik Wasson
description: Senate Republicans intend to propose revised tax and health-care provisions to President Donald Trump’s $3 trillion signature economic package this week, shrugging off condemnations of the legislation by Elon Musk as they rush to enact it before July 4.
title: Senate Republicans Plan to Release Major Revisions to Trump’s Tax Bill

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan should take a bigger role in a regional free trade agreement and use its expansion as a bargaining tool in tariff negotiations with the US, the leader of the country’s largest opposition party said on Monday.
title: Japan Should Use Asia Trade Bloc in US Talks, Party Chief Says

author: Matthew Hill
description: The African Credit Rating Agency, a continental initiative to provide alternative assessments of repayment risks, plans to start operations by the end of September.
title: African Ratings Agency Prepares to Take On ‘Big Three’ This Year

author: Joe Mayes
description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said members of the military alliance need to deliver a “quantum leap” in their collective defense amid the ongoing threat from Russia.
title: NATO’s Rutte Calls For ‘Quantum Leap’ in Defense Investment

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Sakura Murakami
description: South Korea’s President Lee Jae-myung and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba held their first phone conversation and vowed to seek ways to deepen bilateral ties so both nations can respond together to future challenges.
title: S. Korea’s Lee, Japan’s Ishiba Vow to Boost Ties in First Call

author: Alisa Odenheimer, Jon Herskovitz
description: Israel intercepted a humanitarian aid ship trying to reach Gaza that was carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg, the group operating the vessel said.
title: Israel Blocks Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza, Group Says

author: Alastair Gale
description: A Chinese aircraft carrier made one of its deepest forays into the Pacific Ocean over the weekend as Beijing continues to project its military power further from its shores.
title: Chinese Aircraft Carrier Seen Operating Deeper Into Pacific

author: Matthew Bristow, Patricia Laya
description: Last Thursday, presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia was fast sinking back into its violent past. Two days later, a gunman shot him in the head during a rally.
title: Senator in Intensive Care Shows Colombia Spinning Out of Control

author: Virginia Van Natta, Isabela Fleischmann
description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass called for peace as thousands of people demonstrating against immigration raids clashed with security forces for a third day.
title: LA Mayor Bass Seeks Peace After Trump Calls in National Guard
